media:group.media:description:
ğŸ“ Senior Azerbaijani officials reiterated that signing a normalization deal hinges on Armenia removing indirect references to Nagorno-Karabakh from its constitution and called Armeniaâ€™s â€˜mass militarizationâ€™ a major threat to the process. ğŸ“ Russian President Vladimir Putin called Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev to review the state of ongoing efforts to reach a normalization deal. ğŸ“ Opposition leader Bagrat Galstanyan confirmed he is planning to resume protests against Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan next month. ğŸ“ An appeals court shortened the detention period of former government minister and Pashinyan critic Armen Ashotyan, raising expectations he may be released imminently.

entry.title: The Russian Revolution and the Making of a Self-Denying Empire

media:group.media:title: The Russian Revolution and the Making of a Self-Denying Empire
media:group.media:description:
Historians Sheila Fitzpatrick and Ronald Grigor Suny deliver a lecture on class and nationality in the Russian Empire at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 1 in Yerevan.
Sheila Fitzpatrick is an Australian historian renowned for her expertise on Soviet and modern Russian history, particularly during Joseph Stalinâ€™s rule.
Ronald Grigor Suny is a distinguished professor of history at the University of Michigan and emeritus professor of political science and history at the University of Chicago This yearâ€™s Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

entry.title: EU monitors patrol the Armenia-Azerbaijan border

media:group.media:title: EU monitors patrol the Armenia-Azerbaijan border
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet takes you to the Armenia-Azerbaijan border with monitors from the European Union Mission in Armenia to see their work first hand in the fragile area. The mission was deployed last year at Armeniaâ€™s request in the wake of repeated cross-border attacks by Azerbaijan. Besides reporting the facts on the ground to Brussels, the mission strives to decrease tensions for those living near the border who are impacted by the conflict every day.

entry.title: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi speaks at Golden Apricot film festival in Yerevan

media:group.media:title: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi speaks at Golden Apricot film festival in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
In a rare public appearance, renowned Iranian filmmaker and screenwriter Jafar Panahi sits down with Russian film critic Anton Dolin and attendees at this yearâ€™s Golden Apricot International Film Festival in Yerevan, Armenia. Panahi fields audience questions on the art of filmmaking amid state censorship and his experience in prison in Iran. Panahi was recognized as a guest of honor at this yearâ€™s Golden Apricot, marking his first festival visit after 14 years of imprisonment and house arrest in Iran.
